case_vignette: A 30-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with a recent episode of chest pain. She says she was previously well and denies any history of similar symptoms. She reports that, at onset, she felt as if she was going to die and says her heart beating has been beating really fast. There was also profuse sweating, and she says she feels short of breath. She could not recall how long the event lasted but can remember that the symptoms did go away on their own by the time she arrived at the emergency department. Her vitals rapidly returned to normal while giving her medical history and she begins to look and act more calm. No significant past medical history or current medications.  Physical examination is unremarkable. Her electrocardiogram and initial cardiac enzymes are normal.
question: Which the following is necessary to confirm the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I had a recent episode of chest pain, felt like I was going to die, my heart was beating really fast, I was sweating a lot, and I felt short of breath.
Have you had any chest pain before?
No, I have never had any chest pain like this before.
Have you had any other symptoms such as shortness of breath, nausea, vomiting, or dizziness?
I've been feeling short of breath, but I haven't had any nausea, vomiting, or dizziness.
Have you had any medical history of heart disease or any other cardiovascular conditions?
No, I don't have any significant past medical history.
Have you been taking any medications for any medical conditions?
No, I am not currently taking any medications.
Do you have any family history of heart disease or any other cardiovascular conditions?
I'm sorry, but the information about my family history was not provided.
Final Diagnosis: Myocardial Infarction (Heart Attack)
